intro: Smythea nitida, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its smooth, velvety leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. Smythea nitida is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to drought conditions. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
